required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Ph2b to Evaluate Clinical Efficacy and Safety of Tildacerfont in Adult CAH
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Dose-Ranging Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SPR001 (Tildacerfont) in Adult Subjects With Classic Congenital Adrenal Hyperplasia

brief_summary.textblock: An investigation of the efficacy and safety of up to 52 weeks of treatment with Tildacerfont in subjects with classic CAH who have elevated biomarkers at baseline on their current GC regimen.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a study that will test the efficacy and safety of Tildacerfont. The first 12-weeks will be a double-blind, placebo controlled, dose ranging study. The following 40-weeks will assess the long term safety of Tildacerfont.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Subjects will be randomized in a 1:1 manner to one of three doses of Tildacerfont or Placebo.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in androstenedione [time frame: up to 3 months]
primary_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline of androstenedione at Week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events (safety analysis) [Time Frame: up to 12 months]
secondary_outcome.description: Number and percentage of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events and serious adverse events

other_outcome.measure: Change in adrenal hormones [time frame: up to 12 months]
other_outcome.description: Percentage change from baseline of androstenedione, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and 17-hydroxyprogesterone

other_outcome.measure: Normalization of androstenedione [time frame: up to 12 months]
other_outcome.description: Number and percentage of participants on treatment achieving androstenedione levels below the upper limit of normal, matched for age and sex

arm_group.description: Tildacerfont administered daily via oral tablet for 12 weeks at dose level 1.
Tildacerfont administered daily via oral tablet for 12 weeks at dose level 2.
Tildacerfont administered daily via oral tablet for 12 weeks at dose level 3.
Placebo administered daily via oral tablet for 12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female subjects 18 to 55 years old, inclusive
- Has a documented historical diagnosis of classic CAH due to 21-hydroxylase deficiency based on genetic mutation in CYP21A2 and/or elevated 17-OHP
- Has been on a stable dose of GC replacement ≥15 mg/day and ≤50 mg/day in HC equivalents
- For subjects with the salt-wasting form of CAH, subject has been on a stable dose of mineralocorticoid replacement for ≥3 months before screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has a known or suspected diagnosis of any other known form of classic CAH (not due to 21 hydroxylase deficiency)
- Has a history that includes bilateral adrenalectomy or hypopituitarism
- Has a history of allergy or hypersensitivity to Tildacerfont or any other CRF1 receptor antagonist
- Current treatment with dexamethasone as GC therapy for CAH
- Shows clinical signs or symptoms of adrenal insufficiency

overall_official.affiliation: Dept. of Pediatrics, Divisions of Endocrinology and Genetics & Metabolism, Univ. of Minnesota
